titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Consumer Reports. Frances Warne papers, 1936-1985 and undated RL.11797
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-03-04 15:50:14 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Consumer Reports is a product testing and consumer advocacy nonprofit organization based in Yonkers, N.Y., founded in 1936. Frances Warne was an author, consumer advocate and instructor in home economics and consumer education; co-founder of Consumers Union. The Consumer Reports Frances Warne papers include clippings, correspondence, book manuscripts and drafts, course notes and other printed materials. The bulk of the collection pertains to "Wise Buymanship", a home economics and consumer education manual produced for the YWCA. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Book Files; Personal and Professional Files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Consumer Reports is a product testing and consumer advocacy nonprofit organization based in Yonkers, N.Y., founded in 1936. Frances Warne was an author, consumer advocate and instructor in home economics and consumer education; co-founder of Consumers Union.

Frances Lee Corbett was born in West Virginia in 1898 and raised in the Washington, D.C. area. She obtained an A.B. from Cornell University and a M.S. degree from the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. She married Colston E. Warne in 1920 and the two formed part of the group that founded Consumers Union in 1936. Frances Warne served as an instructor in consumer economics, consumer education and home economics at the University of Massachusetts. She was author of "Wise Buymanship" a manual of consumer education produced by Consumers Union for the YWCA. Frances Warne died in Massachusetts in 1982.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Consumer Reports. Frances Warne papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Consumer Reports. Frances Warne papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0130

relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:

J. Walter Thompson Company. Information Center vertical files;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Public Relations records;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Rena Bartos papers;
Nicole Di Bona Peterson Collection of Advertising Cookbooks;

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Consumer Reports Frances Warne papers include clippings, correspondence, book manuscripts and drafts, course notes and other printed materials. The bulk of the collection pertains to "Wise Buymanship", a home economics and consumer education manual produced for the YWCA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wise Buymanship: A Consumers Union Discussion Manual Prepared for the National Board of the Young Women's Christian Association

did.unittitle: Copy 2 (binder, library copy from Henry Harrap)
Correspondence--Payment dispute with Consumers Union over payment for Wise Buymanship

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes assignments, notes, pamplets and clippings, paper topics, syllabi and other materials used for courses in consumer economics, consumer education and home economics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and documents relating to Warne's will and probate
